Articles.Content:
Salutations, soldiers.

If you are here, it means you are a member of the R.K.M. in the Air Force Division. If you are not, enlist now or leave.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:

OBJECTIVE: Build an VTHL aeroplane that can fly stably upside down. Video or picture proof is required.

REWARD: An upgrade to your rank, shown with a change to your roster and signature

DEADLINE: Zero-hundred hours on the fifteenth day of the first month in the twelfth year of the first decade of the first century of the second millennium

I used the Hummingbird for this one.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5133.0

I used the Hummingbird for this one.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5133.0

HOLY FUCK that thing is gorgeous.

You have high-priority, soldier.

From now on, your name is Private Pony.

You got that?

Now go git.
my upcoming long distance cruiser. more wepons are going to be added. ive named it Liquid-IRN

Salutations, soldiers.

If you are here, it means you are a member of the R.K.M. in the Air Force Division. If you are not, enlist now or leave.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:

OBJECTIVE: Build an VTHL aeroplane that can fly stably upside down. Video or picture proof is required.

REWARD: An upgrade to your rank, shown with a change to your roster and signature

DEADLINE: Zero-hundred hours on the fifteenth day of the first month in the twelfth year of the second decade of the first century of the second millennium

What does VTHL mean?

What does VTHL mean?

Vertical take-off and horizontal landing.

my upcoming long distance cruiser. more wepons are going to be added. ive named it Liquid-IRN

Hah, I like that.

It beats two challenges at once.

You\'re a multi-tasker.

From now on, your name is Private iPhone.

Got that?

Now drop and gimme 20.

Vertical take-off and horizontal landing.

Arent all planes in KSP Vertical take-off, atleast currently ?
No, people sometimes build tiny rockets that move it somewhere away from the launchpad.

My Delta II can fly at any orientation you pilot her in

Brought her down to about 20 meters and pulled up without crashing, too.

OH! I just realized this contest was for planes that can fly upside down!

My first pic of the Humming bird used VTOL systems to hover upside down.

d\'oh

OH! I just realized this contest was for planes that can fly upside down!

My first pic of the Humming bird used VTOL systems to hover upside down.

d\'oh

WHAT!? YOUR PLANE CAN HOVER!?

UPSIDE DOWN!?

Are you the Jesus of KSP?

\'Cause I don\'t believe you.

Just joking, Private Pony.

But seriously, I\'m a Jew, and I hate Christmas.

WHAT!? YOUR PLANE CAN HOVER!?

UPSIDE DOWN!?

Are you the Jesus of KSP?

\'Cause I don\'t believe you.

Just joking, Private Pony.

But seriously, I\'m a Jew, and I hate Christmas.

Look closely...

Look closely...

THE PLOT THICKENS.

This is my entry I named it 'Kapiuks mk2' its not in English

Using a joystick I was able to go stable at 10-12m above the sea.

The armaments come as a complimentary gift for purchase of this ship, thats why they were attached.

www.youtube.com/watch?v=JmKu0D9u7vY&feature

Imagine landing that on the moon... ???

That would be a good challenge, just as hard as balancing a unicycle on a stack of cards.

Too bad my joystick is not very useful, it keeps on getting stuck. Pretty fun to fight the controls though, like a real disaster!

Too bad my joystick is not very useful, it keeps on getting stuck. Pretty fun to fight the controls though, like a real disaster!

Bah, if we could meet, I\'d sell you mine in a heartbeat!
Enjoy not being able to use values farther than 25 degrees from the center! xD

first its VTOL, not VTHL. VTHL leads me to this

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_Toronto_Hockey_League

, VTOL leads me to this

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VTOL

Second there are pilots on this forums that refuse to use rcs on aircraft on this forums (or just me). I also refuse to use ASAS on small aircraft for economic reasons.

first its VTOL, not VTHL.

It is VTHL

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VTHL#VTHL

DEADLINE: Zero-hundred hours on the fifteenth day of the first month in the twelfth year of the first decade of the first century of the second millennium

That math doesn\'t make sense...

That math doesn\'t make sense...

Oops.

Meh, I\'m not going to change it.

People get it.
